glsa.title: Groovy: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: Groovy is vulnerable to a remote execution of arbitrary code when java serialization is used.

background.p: A multi-faceted language for the Java platform

description.p: Groovyâ€™s MethodClosure class, in runtime/MethodClosure.java, is vulnerable to a crafted serialized object.

impact.p: Remote attackers could potentially execute arbitrary code, or cause Denial of Service condition

workaround.p: A workaround exists by using a custom security policy file utilizing the standard Java security manager, or do not rely on serialization to communicate remotely.

resolution.p: All Groovy users should upgrade to the latest version:
